timeline.bodyText: Can we move the transaction context to strand locals similar to observation context
timeline.author: warunalakshitha

replies.bodyText: yes, we need to do that. But will be a separate pr because it's tightly coupled to transaction langlib.
replies.author: manuranga

timeline.bodyText: This is not necessary. Is it? Because in the next line it will automatically throw Nullpointer and throwing this exception explicitly is not recommended AFAIK
timeline.author: riyafa

replies.bodyText:
below object.call is in a lambda, therefor error gets thrown in a different thread. so the original stack trace is lost.
Explicit null pointer exception is ok for parameter checking. eg: http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk8/jdk8/jdk/file/687fd7c7986d/src/share/classes/java/util/Objects.java#l201
replies.author: manuranga

replies.bodyText:
Reading on this, came across this: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3322638/is-it-okay-to-throw-nullpointerexception-programmatically
It seems to be a point of argument 😀
replies.author: riyafa

timeline.bodyText: Shall we also create an issue for the Todo and link here or fix the Todo before the PR is merged?
timeline.author: riyafa

timeline.bodyText: Shall we try not to make public variables? We can use getters for any future variables. I know this class already uses a lot of public variables, but we can try to reduce them in the future
timeline.author: riyafa

replies.bodyText: We will hide this from others using java 9 modules. But better to keep things public here, as long as they are only accessed by us (runtime module) for performance reasons. what do you think?
replies.author: manuranga

timeline.bodyText: Why did we make this public? I thought we are getting rid of it?
timeline.author: Kishanthan

replies.bodyText: We will hide this from others using java 9 modules. but needs to be public here because I need to access it from Environment.
